packs.subdomain: Active Directory Logical Structure: Forests, Trees, and Domains

resources.title: Understanding the Active Directory Logical Model
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation explaining the Active Directory logical model. It covers the core components including forests, domains, and organizational units (OUs), and how they form a hierarchical structure for managing network resources.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Logical Structure: Forests, Trees, and Domains

resources.title: Set Up a New Active Directory Forest and Domain on Windows Server
resources.description: A step-by-step video tutorial that walks through the entire process of creating a new Active Directory forest and domain on Windows Server. This practical guide covers OS preparation, promotion to a domain controller, and post-promotion verification.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Logical Structure: Forests, Trees, and Domains

resources.title: Active Directory Basics Virtual Lab
resources.description: A hands-on virtual lab where you can practice configuring a Domain Controller and using Active Directory to manage users and groups. This is a practical exercise to reinforce foundational concepts.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Logical Structure: Forests, Trees, and Domains

resources.title: Active Directory structure | active directory tutorial
resources.description: A concise video explaining both the logical and physical structures of Active Directory. It clearly defines objects, organizational units, domains, trees, and forests in a beginner-friendly format.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Logical Structure: Forests, Trees, and Domains

resources.title: Active Directory Forest: What it is and best practices for managing it
resources.description: A well-structured article that defines and differentiates the main tiers of Active Directory: domains, trees, and forests. It also explains their purpose, with the domain as a management boundary and the forest as a security boundary.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Logical Structure: Forests, Trees, and Domains

resources.title: Active Directory Schema (AD Schema)
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation detailing the Active Directory schema. It provides formal definitions of every object class and attribute that can be created in an Active Directory forest.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Objects and Attributes

resources.title: Introduction to AD DS
resources.description: This Microsoft Learn module covers the fundamentals of Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS), including users, groups, computers, organizational units (OUs), and how to manage these objects and their properties.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Objects and Attributes

resources.title: Active Directory Lab: Creating OUs, Users, Groups & Computers
resources.description: A step-by-step video tutorial demonstrating how to create and manage essential Active Directory objects like Organizational Units (OUs), users, groups, and computer accounts in a lab environment.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Objects and Attributes

resources.title: All Attributes
resources.description: A comprehensive reference list from Microsoft of all attributes defined by Active Directory. This is a valuable resource for administrators and developers needing detailed information on specific attributes.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Objects and Attributes

resources.title: How to View and Change Active Directory Object Attributes
resources.description: A written, step-by-step guide that explains how to view and modify the attributes of an Active Directory object using various tools like ADSI Edit, Active Directory Users and Computers (ADUC) with Advanced Features enabled, and PowerShell.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Objects and Attributes

packs.subdomain: Organizational Units and Delegation of Control in Active Directory

resources.title: Delegating Administration by Using OU Objects
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation explaining how to use organizational units (OUs) to delegate the administration of objects like users and computers. It covers the principles of delegation and why OUs are used for this purpose.
resources.source_subdomain: Organizational Units and Delegation of Control in Active Directory

resources.title: Delegation of Control in AD DS on Windows Server
resources.description: This official Microsoft guide provides a detailed explanation of delegation of control in Active Directory Domain Services. It outlines the prerequisites and provides step-by-step instructions on how to use the Delegation of Control Wizard to assign administrative tasks.
resources.source_subdomain: Organizational Units and Delegation of Control in Active Directory

resources.title: Delegate Control in Active Directory (Step-by-Step Guide)
resources.description: A detailed, step-by-step written tutorial that demonstrates how to use the delegation of control wizard for common scenarios like resetting passwords, modifying group memberships, and managing computer accounts. It also includes best practices for OU design.
resources.source_subdomain: Organizational Units and Delegation of Control in Active Directory

resources.title: 70-742 Lab 3, Creating and Managing Active Directory Groups and Organizational Units OUs
resources.description: This video lab walks through creating and managing OUs and groups in Active Directory. A key part of the lab is a practical exercise on using OUs to delegate administrative tasks with the Delegation of Control wizard.
resources.source_subdomain: Organizational Units and Delegation of Control in Active Directory

resources.title: Administer Active Directory Domain Services
resources.description: A comprehensive learning path from Microsoft that covers the creation, deployment, and maintenance of an Active Directory environment. It includes specific modules on defining organizational units and delegating permissions to manage AD objects.
resources.source_subdomain: Organizational Units and Delegation of Control in Active Directory

packs.subdomain: Active Directory Group Types and Scopes

resources.title: Active Directory Security Groups
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation explaining the fundamentals of Active Directory security groups. It details the two group types (Security and Distribution) and the three group scopes (Universal, Global, and Domain Local).
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Group Types and Scopes

resources.title: 70-742 Lab 3, Creating and Managing Active Directory Groups and Organizational Units OUs
resources.description: A detailed, step-by-step lab video that walks through creating and managing Active Directory groups and Organizational Units (OUs). The lab covers creating different group scopes and delegating management tasks.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Group Types and Scopes

resources.title: "Group Types & Group Scopes" in Active Directory
resources.description: A concise video tutorial that clearly explains the differences between Security and Distribution groups, and details the three group scopes: Domain Local, Global, and Universal, including when to use each.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Group Types and Scopes

resources.title: Active Directory Groups Tutorial
resources.description: A written, step-by-step tutorial on creating and understanding Active Directory groups. It covers the creation process, group types (Security vs. Distribution), and provides a simple breakdown of group scopes (Domain Local, Global, Universal).
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Group Types and Scopes

resources.title: Manage users and groups
resources.description: A short, introductory Microsoft Learn module that covers the basics of managing users and groups in Active Directory. It includes descriptions of Distribution and Security groups as part of its learning objectives.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Group Types and Scopes

packs.subdomain: Active Directory Domain Controllers and FSMO Roles

resources.title: Active Directory Flexible Single Master Operation (FSMO) roles in Windows
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation detailing the five FSMO roles in Active Directory. It explains the purpose of each role, covering both forest-wide and domain-wide operations masters.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Domain Controllers and FSMO Roles

resources.title: Manage AD DS domain controllers and FSMO roles
resources.description: A structured learning module from Microsoft that covers essential management and maintenance tasks for AD DS domain controllers, including deployment, backup, recovery, and managing the five FSMO roles. This module is part of the AZ-800 certification path.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Domain Controllers and FSMO Roles

resources.title: How to Transfer FSMO Roles (2 Easy Steps)
resources.description: A step-by-step tutorial that demonstrates how to transfer FSMO roles using both PowerShell and the Active Directory GUI tools. This guide is practical for administrators needing to perform maintenance or decommission a domain controller.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Domain Controllers and FSMO Roles

resources.title: AZ-800: Manage AD DS Domain Controllers and FSMO Roles
resources.description: A detailed video tutorial that covers the concepts of managing Active Directory Domain Controllers and FSMO roles, aligning with the Microsoft AZ-800 exam. The video explains each role and demonstrates how to transfer or seize them.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Domain Controllers and FSMO Roles

packs.subdomain: Active Directory Authentication and Kerberos in a Domain Environment

resources.title: Kerberos authentication in Windows Server
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation providing a comprehensive overview of the Kerberos version 5 authentication protocol implementation in Windows Server. It covers the primary security features, benefits like single sign-on (SSO) and delegated authentication, and how it's integrated with Active Directory Domain Services.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Authentication and Kerberos in a Domain Environment

resources.title: HowTo Configure Active Directory for Kerberos Authentication
resources.description: A step-by-step video tutorial that walks through the process of configuring Active Directory for Kerberos authentication. It covers creating the necessary user accounts and setting Service Principal Names (SPNs) using PowerShell, which is essential for services to be authenticated via Kerberos.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Authentication and Kerberos in a Domain Environment

resources.title: Active Directory Exploitation Labs
resources.description: A hands-on learning path focused on the security aspects of Active Directory. While covering broader exploitation techniques, it includes specific labs like 'Kerberoasting with Rubeus' that provide practical experience with Kerberos-based attacks and vulnerabilities in a controlled lab environment.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Authentication and Kerberos in a Domain Environment

resources.title: Managing and Maintaining Windows Server 2019 Active Directory Domain Services
resources.description: This course covers the essential skills for maintaining an Active Directory environment. A specific module, 'Configuring Service Authentication and Account Policies', delves into managing Service Principal Names (SPNs), Kerberos policy settings, and Kerberos constrained delegation.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Authentication and Kerberos in a Domain Environment
